medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in October 2000 with increasing pain and swelling of the left knee, which worsened despite treatment. In late October, additional symptoms developed including left forearm edema, olecranon bursitis, and tenosynovitis. Subsequent treatments with immunosuppressants did not improve the patient's condition, leading to the development of nodular lesions and ulceration of extremities. His condition led to hospitalization in late January 2001 after biopsy revealed Sporothrix schenckii.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of psoriasis; previous treatments include multiple immunosuppressants (etanercept, infliximab, methotrexate, leflunomide) for arthritis.
medical_history.social_history: Lives on a 10-acre farm with numerous wild rose bushes; reported years of heavy alcohol use, consuming approximately 1 gallon of whiskey per week.
